org.openimaj.image

Class ImageUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.ImageUtilities

  • public class ImageUtilities
extends Object
    A static utility class with methods for dealing with images.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Method Detail

      • getNormalisedColourPlanes

        public static FImage[] getNormalisedColourPlanes(BufferedImage bimg)
        Calculate normalised RGB planes. Extracts the planes from the given RGB BufferedImage and returns an array of FImage of length 3. The images are ordered Red, Green and Blue.
        Parameters:
        bimg - A BufferedImage from which the planes are extracted.
        Returns:
        An array of FImage.

      • createWorkingImage

        public static BufferedImage createWorkingImage(BufferedImage bimg)
        Returns a ARGB BufferedImage, even if the input BufferedImage is not ARGB format.
        Parameters:
        bimg - The BufferedImage to normalise to ARGB
        Returns:
        An ARGB BufferedImage

      • write

        public static void write(Image<?,?> image,
                         String formatName,
                         File output)
                  throws IOException
        Write the given image to the given file with the given format name. Format names are the same as used by ImageIO.write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, String, File).
        Parameters:
        image - The image to write.
        formatName - a String containing the informal name of the format.
        output - The File to write the image to.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the image cannot be written to the file.

      • write

        public static void write(Image<?,?> image,
                         String formatName,
                         OutputStream output)
                  throws IOException
        Write the given image to the given file with the given format name. Format names are the same as used by ImageIO.write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, String, OutputStream) .
        Parameters:
        image - The image to write.
        formatName - a String containing the informal name of the format.
        output - The OutputStream to write the image to.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the image cannot be written to the file.

      • write

        public static void write(Image<?,?> image,
                         String formatName,
                         ImageOutputStream output)
                  throws IOException
        Write the given image to the given file with the given format name. Format names are the same as used by ImageIO.write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, String, ImageOutputStream) .
        Parameters:
        image - The image to write.

        IOException - If the image cannot be written to the file.

      • write

        public static void write(Image<?,?> image,
                         File output)
                  throws IOException
        Write the given image to the given file, guessing the format name from the extension. Format names are the same as used by ImageIO.write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, String, File).
        Parameters:
        image - The image to write.
        output - The File to write the image to.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the image cannot be written to the file.

        protected static boolean checkSameSize(Image<?,?>... images)
        Checks whether the width and height of all the given images match.
        Parameters:
        images - The images to compare sizes.
        Returns:

                                   int w,
                                   Image<?,?>... images)
        Checks whether the width and height of all the given images match the given width and height.
        Parameters:
        h - The height to match against all the images
        w - The width to match against all the images
        images - The images to compare sizes.
        Returns:
        TRUE if all the images are wxh in size; FALSE otherwise

      • pnmReadHeader

        protected static int pnmReadHeader(byte[] data,
                                   Map<String,Integer> headerData)
                            throws IOException
        Reads a PNM header from the byte array containing the PNM binary data. The headerData variable will be populated with the header information. Returns the number of bytes read from the array.
        Parameters:
        data - The PNM binary data.
        headerData - A Map to populate with header information.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read from the array.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the byte array does not contain PNM information.

                          throws IOException
        Returns the contents of a file in a byte array.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to read
        Returns:
        A byte array representation of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file cannot be read fully.

      • getBytes

        protected static byte[] getBytes(InputStream stream)
                          throws IOException
        Converts the input stream to a byte array. The input stream is fully read.
        Parameters:
        stream - The InputStream to convert to byte array
        Returns:
        A byte array representation of the InputStream data.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the input stream cannot be fully read.

      • createBufferedImageForDisplay

        public static BufferedImage createBufferedImageForDisplay(Image<?,?> img,
                                                          BufferedImage bimg)
        Convert any image to a BufferedImage.
        Parameters:
        img - image to convert
        bimg - BufferedImage to draw into if possible. Can be null.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage representation

      • createBufferedImageForDisplay

        public static BufferedImage createBufferedImageForDisplay(MBFImage img)
        Efficiently create a TYPE_3BYTE_BGR for display if possible. This is typically much faster than to create and display than an ARGB buffered image. If the input image is not in RGB format, then the ARGB form will be returned instead.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to convert
        Returns:
        the converted image

      • createBufferedImageForDisplay

        public static BufferedImage createBufferedImageForDisplay(MBFImage img,
                                                          BufferedImage ret)
        Efficiently create a TYPE_3BYTE_BGR for display if possible. This is typically much faster than to create and display than an ARGB buffered image. If the input image is not in RGB format, then the ARGB form will be returned instead.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to convert
        ret - the image to draw into if possible. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the converted image. Might not be the same as the ret parameter.

      • createBufferedImage

        public static BufferedImage createBufferedImage(FImage img)
        Efficiently create a TYPE_BYTE_GRAY for display. This is typically much faster than to create and display than an ARGB buffered image.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to convert
        Returns:
        the converted image

      • createBufferedImage

        public static BufferedImage createBufferedImage(FImage img,
                                                BufferedImage ret)
        Efficiently create a TYPE_BYTE_GRAY for display. This is typically much faster than to create and display than an ARGB buffered image.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to convert
        ret - BufferedImage to draw into if possible. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the converted image

                                          float[] p2)
        Alpha composites the pixel p1 with the pixel p2, returning the value in pixel p1
        Parameters:
        p1 - The first pixel
        p2 - The second pixel
        Returns:
